Medical Sales Representative Job at First KBZ Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        First KBZ Nigeria Limited - We are committed to helping you improve operational efficiency, provide a better customer experience with modern technology services available from around the world. Our skilled staff, combined with years of experience is guaranteed to provide what you need.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Medical Sales Representative
Job Locations: Abuja, Lagos, & Kano
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a qualified and performance-driven Medical Sales Representative to join our growing team.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for promoting the company’s range of medical and laboratory products, strengthening customer relationships, and contributing to the achievement of organizational sales objectives.
	This role is for professionals who understand the medical sales environment and are hungry to outperform targets.


Key Responsibilities


	Promote and sell assigned medical and laboratory products within the assigned territory
	Actively prospect, pitch, and close new accounts
	Grow and manage existing client portfolios to increase monthly revenue
	Identify new business opportunities and follow up on leads
	Achieve monthly and quarterly sales targets
	Provide product information, demonstrations, and after-sales support
	Monitor market trends, competitor activities, and customer feedbacks
	Prepare sales reports and submit regular activity updates.


Requirements


	A Degree or relevant qualification in Biological or Life Sciences, Medical Laboratory Science, or a related discipline is an added advantage.
	Minimum of 2 – 3 years of relevant experience in medical or pharmaceutical sales
	Strong track record of meeting or exceeding sales target
	Strong communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills
	High level of professionalism, integrity, and self-motivation
	Ability to work independently and meet defined performance targets
	Residency in Lagos, Abuja or Kano is mandatory.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and performance-based incentives
	Opportunity for career growth and earning potential
	Supportive and professional work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@firstkbzltd.com using “Medical Sales Representative – Lagos” or “Medical Sales Representative – Abuja” or Medical Sales Representative – Kano” as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Our work sits at the intersection of media production, experiential events, branding, and strategy.

As we enter our next growth phase, we are seeking a Chief Operating Officer (COO) who will not only manage operations but a possibility to co-build the company strategically.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Chief Operating Officer (COO)

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary
     

            
    




	The COO will be responsible for driving operational excellence, scaling systems, and translating vision into execution across MediaStyle Concept’s media, events, and business development functions.
	This role is ideal for a seasoned operator, strategist, or business leader who desires more than a traditional executive seat—someone motivated to build, scale, and share in long-term value creation.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead day-to-day operations across media production, events, and client servicing
	Design and implement scalable operational systems, workflows, and SOPs
	Drive business growth strategies in collaboration with the Founder
	Oversee project delivery, timelines, budgets, and quality control
	Coordinate internal teams, freelancers, vendors, and strategic partners
	Manage financial planning, cost control, and operational profitability
	Support investor relations, partnerships, and high-level negotiations
	Represent MediaStyle Concept in executive meetings, pitches, and alliances


Who We’re Looking For


	Proven experience in operations, business development, consulting, media, events, or creative industries
	Strong strategic thinking with hands-on execution capability
	Demonstrated ability to build systems, manage people, and scale businesses
	Entrepreneurial mindset with comfort in fast-moving, growth-stage environments
	Excellent communication, leadership, and negotiation skills
	High integrity, accountability, and long-term vision.


Quasi-Partner Structure:


	This role goes beyond employment. The successful candidate may:
	Participate in profit-sharing or equity-linked arrangements
	Play a key role in strategic direction and expansion decisions
	Grow into a formal partnership position based on performance and alignment
	(Exact structure to be discussed during advanced stages.).


Why Join us


	Opportunity to co-build a respected, scalable media and events brand
	Direct influence on strategy, growth, and market positioning
	Flexible structure with strong upside potential
	Collaborative leadership culture driven by creativity and impact.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: mediastylecompany@gmail.com using  "Chief Operating Officer (COO)". as the subject of the mail.
